body_html:
Makes sense to me. Just wanted to check that this is deliberate.
On Sat, Sep 10, 2016 at 09:21 Derek Murray notifications@github.com wrote:

@martinwicke https://github.com/martinwicke I'd rather keep this
simplified one as a temporary measure (until the two PIP packages are at
parity) than refactor the main setup.py with a bunch of conditional flags
that we're eventually not going to need. Does that make sense?

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub

Makes sense to me. Just wanted to check that this is deliberate.
On Sat, Sep 10, 2016 at 09:21 Derek Murray notifications@github.com wrote:

> @martinwicke https://github.com/martinwicke I'd rather keep this
> simplified one as a temporary measure (until the two PIP packages are at
> parity) than refactor the main setup.py with a bunch of conditional flags
> that we're eventually not going to need. Does that make sense?
